refnamediv.refpurpose: a vertical slider widget for selecting a value from a range.

refsynopsisdiv.title: Synopsis

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The GtkVScale widget is used to allow the user to select a value using a vertical slider. To create one, use gtk_hscale_new_with_range().
The position to show the current value, and the number of decimal places shown can be set using the parent GtkScale class's functions.

refsect2.title: struct GtkVScale
refsect2.para: The GtkVScale-struct struct contains private data only, and should be accessed using the functions below.

listitem.simpara: the GtkAdjustment which sets the range of the scale.

refsect2.title: gtk_vscale_new_with_range ()
refsect2.para: Creates a new vertical scale widget that lets the user input a number between min and max (including min and max) with the increment step. step must be nonzero; it's the distance the slider moves when using the arrow keys to adjust the scale value.

listitem.simpara: step increment (tick size) used with keyboard shortcuts
